dialogues.text: The sun begins to disappear behind silhouetted mountains, throwing long, dark shadows down the empty street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli continues to stare at the telegraph, unnerved. The da almost over...and it hasn’t made a sound. Suddenly, Eli hears squeaking wheels outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Sullivan rides into town beside a HORSE-DRAWN WAGON Tom and Edward Donovan are upfront, holding the reins. Su and Rosaleigh are in back, caring for the girl... TOWNSPEOPLE come outside as the wagon passes by. They tur and glance at each other. Suspicious. Afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Ben walk across the room and stand over Georg now passed out in a drunken stupor...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hey, George! Charlie kicks the chair, George suddenly wakes up-- CHARLIE (CONT’D) Your wife’s outside. Incase you're interested... George rubs his tired eyes, then leans over and grabs the bottle...and pours himself another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli Peterson watches the wagon stop outside Sue’s clinic. opens the door and steps outside. The bell chimes loudly. ...-but then the sound fades and Eli hears something else slowly turns and peers through the window-- The telegraph ticker has started typing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Nathan cross the street to help Frank, Tom, a Edward lift the girl out of the wagon.  56. Together, they carry her toward Sue’s clinic... TOWNSPEOPLE crowd the other side of the street, watching a distance, refusing to come any closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Tom, Edward, Rosaleigh, Sue, Patrick, and Nathan c the girl into the clinic and set her down by the window.. Sue checks the girl’s pulse and gives her a shot of MORPH Frank and the others stand nearby, quietly watching... They suddenly hear FOOTSTEPS coming down the hall. The do slowly opens...and Eli enters the room. He looks at everyone, then hands Tom a slip of paper--

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: From Kansas City... Tom grabs the wire and starts to read...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (To Eli) What’s with everyone outside? Town seems panicked...

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: You can thank George Fowler for that. He’s been spouting off at the saloon to anyone who'll listen. Frank's eyes pulse with anger. Sue looks up, concerned--

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: How long as he been there?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (Hesitates) Awhile. Tom finishes reading and holds up the wire--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: ‘Feds are sending some agents out on the morning train.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What took so long?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You can ask ‘em when they get here. I’m sure everyone’s got questions. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (To Sue) Gonna have Patrick and Nathan stay here tonight. Just to be safe. Sue nods as the deputies take position at the window...

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you need anything else...I’1l be in my office.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: The one with guns in it. Tom tips his hat and leaves with his family. Frank waits the door to shut, then goes to the window-- He watches the Donovan family climb back into their wagon Tom and Rosaleigh both have their arms around Edward... Frank takes a deep breath, then looks down at the young g Her eyes remain closed. She doesn’t even know he’s here.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: You should go home, Mr. Sullivan. We'll take it from here... Frank looks up at Patrick and Nathan, resolved to their d Then he glances at Sue...and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Donovan family rides out of town. Edward glances over shoulder and sees Frank come outside...alone.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I feel bad for him. Tom glances back and slowly nods--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: We all do. AT SUE’S CLINIC Frank stares at the saloon as he un-tethers his horse. He slowly turns...and sees Eli Peterson standing nearby.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: George still over there? Eli hesitates, then nods. Frank charges across the street  58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks up as Frank enters the saloon--

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Hey, Frank...what’ll it be?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Whiskey. Frank looks around the room as the bartender pours. He se George passed out near the back...clutching an empty bott

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hey, Frank...what’s going on? Who's this girl? Frank keeps staring at George. Finally, he answers--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Just someone who needs a little help. That’s all.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I hope there isn’t going to be any trouble. Cemetery’s crowded enough as it is, wouldn’t you say? Frank takes a deep breath as George continues to slump in chair; unconscious, pathetic...not worth the effort.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I think this whole town’s a cemetery, Charlie. Excuse me. Frank turns and walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank climbs back on his horse and trots out into the str The light from Sue’s clinic burns like an oven... Frank stares at her window for a moment, then tugs on his reins in the moonlight...and gallops out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue listens to Frank’s fading horse hooves as she checks girl's vitals. Suddenly, there’s a knock at the door... Sue crosses the room and answers...surprised to see her sister, Kay, standing in the hallway--  59.

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: Where is she? Kay charges past Sue and goes to the girl’s bedside--

dialogues.speaker: KAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dear God. Just as our boys are starting to come home...as if this town hasn’t been through enough?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: There’s no cause for alarm...

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: That’s not what your husband says. Sue looks up at at her sister as another KNOCK raps on th door. Sue hesitates, then turns and crosses the room... She discovers three BOYS (ages 12-14) standing in the hallway, armed with their fathers’ RIFLES...

dialogues.speaker: ELDEST BOY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Fowler...we were wondering if, you could use any help tonight? (Off Sue’s confused look) We could stand guard--

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: Oh, no you could not! Kay charges forward to confront the startled children--

dialogues.speaker: KAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jimmy Rogers, Russell Thompson, and Mitchell Stevens. What kind of foolishness is this?! You all think because you missed out on one war, you need to rush out for a second?! Do your fathers even know their rifles have gone missing? The boys look down at their shuffling feet...guilty. Kay takes the youngest by the hand and turns to face Sue--

dialogues.speaker: KAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hope you and Frank know what you're doing. I really do. (To the young boys) C’mon, you three...you can explain this to your parents. Sue watches her sister leave...then quietly shuts the doo  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay guides the children down the hall. Suddenly, they sto A DARK FIGURE slips quietly past them--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue hears yet another knock and reluctantly crosses the r She opens the door and suddenly freezes... Leonard Duschene is standing before her.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Leonard...what are you doing here? Patrick and Nathan both step forward, alarmed. Leonard hesitates...and finally finds his voice--

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: Does she need blood? Sue stares at him, hoping she heard right--

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: You're O-negative? Leonard nods. Sue grabs him by the arm--

dialogues.speaker: SUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come inside right now. She pulls him into the room and slams the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Are you sure about this, Dr. Fowler?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Get him a chair. Patrick hesitates, then nods to Nathan...who grabs a chai and carries it over to the girl’s bedside. Leonard stares at the young girl as he rolls up his sleev Sue wraps a RUBBER BAND around his arm, then pierces his with an 18-gauge needle. Leonard flinches, but stays quie BLOOD starts to flow, turning the clear tubing red as it falls into a COLLECTING BOTTLE resting on the floor... SUE (CONT’D) Tell me if you get dizzy.  61.

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: I’m fine. His blood continues to fill the bottle, mixing with COAGULANT, rising every second-- 100cc...200cc...300cc...

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: You okay? Leonard slowly nods -- pushing himself to the max... 400cc...500cc...700cc...the glass is almost full. Sue sip off the tubing and removes the needle from Leonard's arm. Leonard slumps in the chair, about to faint. Patrick and Nathan step forward and catch him-- Sue then inserts a NEEDLE into the young girl’s arm and raises the container. Blood flows into the girl’s body. Patrick, Nathan, and Leonard watch, silently captivated.. The bottle finally empties. Sue removes the needle from t girl’s arm as carefully as if she were defusing a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Did it work?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: We'll know in the morning. The deputies both nod, then look back out the window-- Outside, the town sits beneath a blanket of indifferent s .--completely unaware of the wicked doom heading their wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Sullivan wakes up and slowly climbs out of bed. He looks around, sadly. His house is empty, again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stops outside his daughter’s bedroom and looks at t empty bed. Then the floor. Then the fireplace. And then, finally, at the PICTURES hanging on the wall. INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE -- SAME TIME Sunlight pours in through the open window, causing Sue Fo to suddenly wake. She gets up and checks on the girl...  62.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: (Smiles) She’s warm. A TRAIN WHISTLE suddenly shrieks far in the distance... EXT. MAIN STREET -- SHERIFF’S OFFICE -- SAME TIME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom smiles at Rosaleigh as she heads to school. Then he slowly turns and stares out at the horizon-- Tiny puffs of smoke suddenly appear, signaling the immine arrival of FEDERAL AGENTS from Kansas City...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is scrubbing the table where Sue operated on the gi desperately trying to get the blood off the wood... Edward's newspaper is still lying on the counter. Frank w his hands and picks it up-- THE KANSAS CITY GAZETTE The top fold displays bold HEADLINES announcing the end o war. Frank turns the newspaper over-- His eyes suddenly narrow. Buried in the bottom right hand corner, a small HEADLINE ominously reads-- “MOBSTER TRIAL CONTINUES; WITNESS MISSING, FEARED MURDERE Frank sets the newspaper down...and quickly leaves the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom steps onto the platform as a TRAIN pulls into the station, releasing a thick cloud of piping hot steam.. Two FEDERAL AGENTS (Both 30s), dressed in dark suits, ste off the train and take in their surroundings...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You boys from Kansas City? The two agents nod and quickly approach--

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: That’s right. I’m Agent Reynolds. This is Agent Parker. You the one who sent the wire?  63.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Sure am. Tom Donovan. I’m uh... sheriff of this town.

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: Well, Sheriff, there really isn’t a moment to lose...where’s the girl? Tom hesitates, then nods: This way. The two agents glance each other, then follow him down the platform...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay Anderson, busy stocking shelves, glances out the wind and sees Tom approaching with the two agents... She looks at her husband’s crepe, trembling. Afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosaleigh peers out the window, clearly concerned...

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: Mrs. Donovan...? Are we gonna grade our homework now? Rosaleigh doesn’t answer. She doesn’t even seem to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Farley watches quietly as Tom leads the two agen down the street...and into Sue’s clinic-- INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE -- MAIN FLOOR -- SAME TIME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and the agents climb the stairs, in mid-conversation.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: «.+.a local rancher found her. We couldn't figure out where she came from...maybe you boys could shed some light on that? The agents glance at each other as Tom reaches for the do INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE -- CONTINUOUS Sue, Nathan, and Patrick look up as Tom enters with Reyno and Parker. Everyone stands quietly for a moment, then--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Sue, these men are from Kansas City. They’re here for the girl...  64. Sue hesitates, then stands aside. The two agents walk acr the room and stare down at the young girl--

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: That’s her, alright. (Looks around, confused) Where’s the doctor?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Standing right next to you. Reynolds hesitates, then turns to face Sue--

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: So, what’s her condition? She obviously hasn’t died, yet...

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: No, she’s actually improving.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Improving? Your wire said she was shot three times and wouldn’t survive the week...you’re saying she could live?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Yes, she very well could. The two agents glance at each other. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: I can’t tell you how relieved we are to hear that...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, do you mind telling us what’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: Sheriff, I’m afraid the less you know, the better. For your own safety. As well as hers. (Then, to Sue) Is it safe for her to travel? Could she board a train?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s a good idea. Not for awhile, at least.

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: Why not? I thought you said her condition was improving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You moved her here, didn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: That was a few short miles at a snail’s pace. And, even then, she had muscle spasms the whole way... Reynolds and Parker stare at Sue with guarded eyes.. SUE (CONT’D) She’s dehydrated. Her wounds are still open. The slightest exposure could cause infection to set in... that could kill her. Reynolds checks his watch--

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: The next train’s at noon...and she needs to be on it.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Sir, please...

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: Listen, I understand your concern, but it’s a risk we have to take. This girl has enemies. You've seen what they can do. As long as she’s here, this town isn’t safe. (To Tom) Where’s the telegraph, Sheriff?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Down the street...I could take you over there, if you like?

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: I'd appreciate that. (To Sue, an order) Have her ready when we get back. 65. Sue hesitates, then finally nods. The two agents charge o the door. Tom follows close behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli Peterson looks up as the doorbell chimes. Tom enters Reynolds and Parker--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Eli, these men need to send a wire to Kansas City.  66. Eli slowly nods...and slides a FORM across the desk. INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE -- SAME TIME Sue peers out the window as she packs for the girl’s trip Tom and the two agents are walking down the street... Sue watches them approach. Suddenly, she hears something in the distance-- GALLOPING HORSE HOOVES...approaching fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Sullivan comes riding into town. Tom and the two ag stagger back as he dismounts and approaches--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, this is Frank Sullivan, the rancher I was telling ya about. (Beat) Frank, these men are from Kansas City. They’re here for the girl...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. And we owe you a real debt of gratitude. Because of your bravery, that girl is still alive.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Where ya taking her?

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: (a moment, then) Back where she belongs. Frank slowly nods, then looks past Reynolds and Parker. H sees TOWNSPEOPLE peering out of every window...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I read an article about a missing witness in Kansas City...that’s her, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: Like we told your sheriff here... it’s really best for everyone if you know as little as possible.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I bet.  67. A distant TRAIN WHISTLE suddenly shrieks--

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: We should probably be going... Reynolds and Parker tip their hats and turn to leave...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Will you be taking the remains of your dead colleagues, as well? The agents suddenly stop and turn around. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They’re down at the funeral home. I’m sorry pinewood coffins were the best we could do. We had a tough year...as I’m sure you both know.

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: That’s alright, Mr. Sullivan. Their families will understand...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What were their names?

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry? Frank steps forward and repeats himself firmly--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Their names. What were they?

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: David York and Mikey Smith. Good agents. And dear friends. Frank glances at Tom. He knows they’re lying. Another train whistle suddenly shrieks-- REYNOLDS (CONT’D) We really do need to get going... Reynolds and Parker turn once again and head for the stai Frank suddenly steps forward, blocking their path-- REYNOLDS (CONT’D) What’s the idea?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'd like to see your credentials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our what?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: ID, gentlemen. Tom takes a step back, suddenly nervous--

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: In case you haven’t noticed, we're in a bit of a hurry here...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: ‘Better make it quick, then. Reynolds scowls at Frank, suddenly aggressive--

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: Suppose I told you the answer is yes. We do mind?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You'd be breaking the law. But that won’t matter much...

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: And why’s that?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You'll both be dead. Tom stares at Frank in total disbelief. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: Is that a fact?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Not yet. Reynolds glances at Parker, then turns back to Frank--

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: Alright. ID. Here you go... Reynolds and Parker reach inside their jackets...and draw their guns! But Frank is ready. And he’s lightning fast-- He puts a bullet in Parker’s head and fires two rounds in Reynold’s chest. Their bodies snap backwards and hit the ground, flooding the street with thick arterial spray. Frank glances back at Tom, standing in a prison of shock fear; his gun still resting firmly in its holster--  69.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: My God. What have you done? Frank stares at his friend as TOWNSPEOPLE come outside, staring at the carnage in the middle of their street-- Then he glances at the school, where Rosaleigh Donovan is struggling to keep her students away from the window... A slight tremor of movement suddenly catches Frank's eye- “Agent Reynolds” is still alive. He slithers along the gr and reaches for his gun... But Frank’s boot comes down hard, snapping his wrist-- Reynolds screams in agonizing pain. Frank kicks the gun a and pulls the dying man up by his collar...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Their names were William Arthurton and Robert Church... (Beat) And they were no friends of yours.

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: You got me... Reynolds suddenly smiles, dark and evil. REYNOLDS (CONT’D) You people have no fucking idea what’s coming your way... Blood pours out of Reynold’s mouth as the life fades from eyes. His head rolls back and his body grows still... Frank stares at the corpse for a moment, then lets it fal back into the sticky redness covering the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Fowler opens his eyes and slowly gets up. He glanc around the saloon, shocked to find it completely empty... Confused, George goes to the window...and peers outside--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town’s entire POPULATION is standing in the street, watching as two additional COFFINS get carted away...  70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Tom stare out the window. Tom suddenly pulls do the blinds. The room goes dark...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Alright, you tell me...what now? Before Frank can respond, there’s a knock at the door--

dialogues.speaker: TOWNSPERSON
dialogues.text: Tom, I need a word with you!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Earl, I’m a little busy at the moment! I’1l be out in a minute! Tom takes a deep breath and looks back at Frank--

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're in a lot of trouble. INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE -- SAME TIME Patrick and Nathan stare at the madness in the street--

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Should we go down there? Patrick hesitates, then slowly shakes his head--

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Our orders are to protect Dr. Fowler and the girl. We stay here unless told different. Nathan glances at Sue, then reluctantly nods. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Tom come outside and walk quickly down the stre Everyone watches them, some even shout--

dialogues.speaker: TOWNSPERSON
dialogues.text: What’s happening, Tom! What are we supposed to do?!

dialogues.speaker: TOWNSPERSON
dialogues.text: You didn’t have to kill ‘em, Frank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli looks up as Tom enters with Frank--  71.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Eli, you got the wire those men sent out? I’d like to see it...

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: ‘Figured you might. Eli holds up a slip of paper. Tom takes it and reads. His eyes suddenly darken. He hands the message to Frank...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (To Eli) We need to wire all nearby towns and ask for help. You ready?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Just tell me what to type. Eli leads Tom across the room as Frank stares at the mess in his hands. The wire is two simple words-- “SHE'S ALIVE INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE -- MOMENTS LATER The door bursts open and six TOWNSPEOPLE storm into the r

dialogues.speaker: TOWNSPERSON
dialogues.text: Where is she? Is this her? Sue and Leonard block their path...

dialogues.speaker: TOWNSPERSON
dialogues.text: Sue, get out of the way. We have a right to know, goddamnit! What have you and Frank gotten us into?! Sue glances back at Patrick and Nathan. They step forward usher the TOWNSPEOPLE towards the door...

dialogues.speaker: TOWNSPERSON
dialogues.text: This isn’t right, Sue! You know it! Why are you protecting her?! Sue turns the lock as the door slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell chimes as Tom steps outside. Through the win we can see Eli furiously sending out wires... Tom glances down the street and sees Rosaleigh standing w Kay. She gives him a look: What are you going to do? Tom hesitates, then shrugs: I don't know.  72. Eli suddenly taps on the glass. Tom glances back, the urg in Eli’s eyes draws him to the window--

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Message just came through.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: From which town? Dawson? Sparks?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: No...Kansas City. INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE -- LATER The DOOR HANDLE suddenly jiggles against the LOCK--

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Frank... Sue opens the door just wide enough for him to slip throu

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: This is madness... Frank slowly nods, then notices Leonard Duschene standing across the room. Sue follows his gaze-- SUE (CONT’D) The good news is she’s improving... a donor came forward last night and offered quite a bit of blood. (Nods, softly) Looks healthier, doesn’t she? Frank turns and looks down at the girl. She looks just li his daughter...and she could wake up any moment now.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: She's beautiful. Sue stares at Frank as a peaceful moment hangs in the air punctured suddenly a loud knock at the door--

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tom Donovan, open up. Sue opens the door. Tom bursts into the room--  73.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘Got another wire from Kansas City. Tom hands the message to Frank, who reads it out loud--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Didn't take ‘em long to figure out something was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Didn't take who long? Sue’s question goes unanswered...until Frank takes the newspaper out of his jacket, handing it to Tom--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Edward left this at the house yesterday. ‘Must’ve gotten it before boarding... (Off Tom’s look) Bottom right corner. Tom takes the newspaper and slowly reads--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... Tom lets the paper fall to the floor. He goes to the wind as Patrick and Nathan rush forward to pick it up--

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: This is who we’re up against? No wonder it took so long to respond.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. We wired the federal authorities...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Just because we sent a wire doesn’t mean they got it... (Nodding at the newspaper) People this powerful have informants everywhere. Someone got our message and tipped ‘em off... (Then, realizing) ...the feds don’t know what’s happening here. Patrick looks down, Nathan’s eyes flood with panic.  74.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Any word from the other towns?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Nothing yet...

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: We could wire back, pretending to be those men. Say it was all a mistake. ‘Got the wrong girl. (Beat) They might believe it.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Would you? Patrick hesitates, then shakes his head. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Those men were just the beginning. They know she’s here. They know we're protecting her. Right now, they’re summoning every resource at their disposal...and heading straight for us.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I think it’s time to start sending out more wires...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (Dramatic Beat) ‘Goddamn right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Tom come inside and find Eli standing over the telegraph. His face appears ashen. Something is very wron

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Tom, signal just went dead.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What? How?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: ‘Dunno. The equipment’s working. It’s not a problem on our end. (Glances out the window) The line’s been cut somewhere...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Could just be a coincidence...  75.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Or maybe they’re taking the necessary precautions... Tom opens the door and disappears outside. Frank goes to window and stands beside Eli... They stare out at the surrounding forest, wondering if villains are lurking just beyond their view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom charges down the street, stopping beneath Sue’s windo

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (Calling) Patrick! Patrick pokes his head outside--

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, Boss?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Get your horse saddled and meet me outside. You’re riding oughta town.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Kansas City. As fast as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick steps away from the window and glances at Nathan, has a pale white look of envy spread across his face--

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Maybe I should go, instead. My horse is younger, faster.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Kansas City is more than a hundred miles away. You ever ridden that far through the night? (Beat) You wanted an adventure? Looks like you’re going to get one... Patrick turns and walks out the door, leaving Nathan to glance down at the TIN STAR pinned sharply to his vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick kicks his HORSE and gallops out of town. Everyone watches him disappear over the ridge... .--and then they hear a distant TRAIN WHISTLE. Frank and Tom walk towards the station, passing scores of TOWNSPEOPLE frozen where they stand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Tom step onto the platform as a distant TRAIN c towards them through blue-grey twilight... Tom slowly exhales. His hands are trembling...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Cold? Tom slowly shakes his head, then quietly says--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It isn’t fair... (Off Frank’s look) I've done everything I was supposed to do. I didn’t ask to be sheriff and I never went looking for trouble. When you stepped forward and volunteered for the Philippines, I stood aside. My hands are clean... Frank hesitates, then steps closer--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Tom...nobody from Kansas City is going to be on this train.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (a moment, then) They’1l wait for it to get dark. Tom takes another deep breath, steadying his nerves--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Let’s just hope the conductor’s willing to help us... The train’s whistle shrieks as it nears the station. Fran and Tom step forward. But then something terrible happens  77. The train doesn't stop. It soars past them with devastati speed, each car a bullet in the air... Frank and Tom watch the train grow small in the distance. this is worse than they could’ve possibly imagined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TOWN has gathered for a meeting. People scream and sh fighting for seats. Before long, it’s standing room only-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue, Leonard, and Nathan stare out the window -- watching the entire town shuffles into the church... Sue sees her sister in the crowd, then Rosaleigh and Edwa Donovan. And, finally, Eli Peterson, not far behind... And then Sue’s eyes suddenly narrow-- George is stumbling down the street. He glances up at Sue briefly, then disappears inside the church...

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I wonder if my wife’s over there. We have a little girl. Just turned six months old...

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: You can leave if you want. Nobody's forcing you to stay.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (Hesitates) No, it’s my duty to protect you... and that’s what I’m going to do. The door suddenly opens and Frank enters with Tom; their shoulders sagging under a heavy burden--

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: No good? Frank shakes his head as Tom goes to the window--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What’s going on at the church?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: They called a town meeting...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: My family over there?  78.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Just saw ‘em go in... Tom turns and quickly leaves. Frank glances at the girl--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How’s she doing?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Fine, assuming she doesn’t get handed over to a lynch mob. Frank looks up at Sue and she begs him with her eyes to g over and face his critics. He turns and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting is underway. A RANCHER (30s) has the floor--

dialogues.speaker: RANCHER
dialogues.text: Could more of ‘em be coming?

dialogues.speaker: RANCHER
dialogues.text: Oh, they’re coming, alright. Just as sure as God’s vengeance. Frank Sullivan killed two of their men. That’s not the sort of thing you get to just walk away from... Ben Sanderford comes down the aisle, distributing BLACK & WHITE PHOTOGRAPHS to different people--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Went over to the Hall of Records and got these pictures. This is what we’re up against... TOWNSPEOPLE gasp as they look at the pictures; each one a grisly crime scene with blood-soaked corpses-- BEN (CONT’D) They have guns that fire thirty rounds a second. And they’re capable of this... Ben holds up a particularly gruesome photograph. Many TOWNSPEOPLE turn away, unable to stomach the macabre...

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now we don’t know who this girl is or what she’s done. But one thing is certain...she has a past. It’s dark and it’s ugly. And it wants her dead.  79. The photographs get passed up to Reverend Farley. He look them quietly as Charlie Foster stands up to speak-- CHARLIE (CONT’D) I don’t like this, folks. Not one bit. Girl was supposed to testify at some trial? Okay. She got scared? Fine. I can understand that. Hell, we all can. But then she runs away and makes her problems our own. And that’s not okay. I don’t like people who run away from responsibility. It never ends good. Look at Leonard Duschene. He deserted the army and who paid the price? We did. Victims of the plague he was carrying in his veins. Innocent people always pay the price when cowards abandon their duty. It’s happened before. And it’s happening now... (Beat) Earlier today, I watched two men die less than a hundred yards from where my children go to school. It isn’t right. It isn’t fair. It’s not our responsibility! TOWNSPEOPLE voice their agreement as Charlie sits down...

dialogues.speaker: IN A NEARBY PEW
dialogues.text: George Fowler stares at one of the grisly photographs; a terrible rage building inside of him...

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF THE ROOM
dialogues.text: The door softly opens and Tom Donovan comes inside. He si down by his family as a WOMAN (40s) stands up to speak--

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: I don’t want my husband risking his life for some stranger. For all we know, this girl might even deserve what’s coming to her. We’ve already lost so many people. How much can one town be expected to endure? Our soldiers have already been through so much terror overseas. The last thing I want is for them to come home orphans. The woman sits down as soft murmurs begin to ripple throu the church. Reverend Farley suddenly looks up...  80. Frank Sullivan is standing at the door. The room grows deathly quiet. Frank looks around, about to speak when-- George Fowler suddenly stands up, drunk and loud. He star at Frank; his eyes flickering with the promise of violenc Everyone waits anxiously for something to happen. And the George Fowler turns and storms out of the church...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George charges across the street, each footstep angrier t the last; his hatred gathering momentum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue, Leonard, and Nathan look up as the door bursts open. George Fowler comes inside, his eyes dark and angry...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I'd like to speak to my wife. Nathan and Leonard look at Sue. She nods, it’s okay. Geor waits for them to leave, then charges towards her...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Don’t play dumb with me. You know exactly what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: I’m a doctor. This is my job.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Your job?! She is not your patient. The folks out there are. And you’re about to get them all killed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard and Nathan stand in the lobby, listening to the m sounds of George and Sue arguing upstairs...

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Should we go up?  81. Leonard hesitates, unsure. The fighting grows louder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George leans closer, getting right in Sue’s face--

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this? Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Stay away from me... George grabs her by the arm and pulls her close...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Tell me why! Why are you putting this town at risk? For him?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: God, you’re drunk... George slaps her face, hard. Sue screams--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard hears Sue’s cry and sprints up the stairs... Nathan remains frozen where he stands; his face torn apar anguish and shame. He suddenly looks down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George hits Sue again, this time with a closed fist--

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You want to help Frank save this whore so that you can be his!? That's it, isn’t it? It’s been your reason all along... George throws her to the ground, about to stomp her... Leonard bursts into the room and grabs George from behind George stumbles back, then drives an elbow into Leonard's solar plexus and hurls him across the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan hears a LOUD CRASH upstairs and suddenly looks awa There’s no such thing as bravery. Only varying degrees of fear. And Deputy Nathan is crumbling...  82. He slowly unfastens his TIN STAR and sets it down. Then h goes to the door...and disappears into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George tears through the room, knocking everything to the ground. Sue gets to her feet and charges towards him--

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Get out of here! George grabs her throat and slams her down on the desk--

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Did you let his family die? So you and he could be together just like you wanted? To hell with this town! To hell with these people! Just as long Sue gets what she wanted! He hits her again and again...each punch a sickening thud against her skull; brutal and awful-- His knuckles split and start to bleed. George grimaces as steps away, letting his wife’s limp body fall to the floo He shakes his hand for a moment and catches his breath. T he steps forward...and approaches the young girl-- She continues to sleep, calm and peaceful; completely una of the battle raging around her. George stares at her with murder in his eyes... And then, as if suddenly realizing the barbarity of what done, George Fowler backs away. And quietly leaves the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Sullivan stands in a sea of hostility, listening to various TOWNSPEOPLE express their grievances--

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I remember when our boys were getting drafted, you said the war was wrong, that it wasn’t our fight. But now you’re asking us to risk our lives? For someone we don’t even know? Have you lost your mind?! She may look like your daughter, but that doesn’t mean she’s worth saving... (Beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You owe us an explanation. You've wagered all our lives on this. Everyone shouts in agreement as the man sits back down. F takes a deep breath, gathering his thoughts--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m not sure what to say, except... this is our home, not some battle- field halfway across the world.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: It’s a fight we didn’t ask for!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Maybe not...but it’s coming just the same.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (Emotional) First, it was the sickness. Then the war. Now this. It’s too much, I tell you...too much. Frank stares at the man, not sure what to say. And then h sees Kay Anderson standing across the room--

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: My husband died eight months ago when the flu spread through town. Two days later, I watched my only son march off to war... (Gathering herself) And every night since then, I’ve prayed for just one thing. That my boy would come back to me...alive. (Beat) He’s due in next Thursday. Kay stares at Frank for moment, then--

dialogues.speaker: KAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You and my sister did right in trying to help this girl. Nobody faults you for that. It was Christian charity, fine and decent. (Beat) But when you killed those men today, you invited the devil back into our town. It’s your mistake, not ours. And we shouldn’t have to pay for it. I’m begging you... (Beat) Let this cup pass from us.  84. Kay slowly sits down. Frank turns to face everyone--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What would you have me do? Wheel her out into the street so we can all close our windows and pretend we don’t hear the gunfire? (Looks up at Farley) Should we put the girl in God's hands and call it a day?

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND FARLEY
dialogues.text: There are worse hands to be in, Frank. Much worse.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That may be. But it wasn’t so long ago that you wouldn’t even set foot in our cemetary to conduct a funeral. You remember? Because I do. Sometimes God’s hands are no match against fear...

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND FARLEY
dialogues.text: You think I’m a coward, Frank? Is that it? You think we’re all cowards? Well, maybe we are... (Beat) But I will tell you this: our community has been through the darkest of nights. Look around you. Maybe you'll be struck, as I am, by all the people who aren’t here. (Points to various people) Ella-May lost her husband of fifty- three years. Mary Richardson lost her new baby boy. The Fuller’s son died at Verdun; the Cooper’s boy at Belleau Wood. The Stevenson’s graciously adopted the three Randall children after both their parents were killed. (Beat) There isn’t a single family here who hasn’t been touched by the tragedy of the past year. And now, just when the sun is finally starting to rise... (Holds up one of the gruesome photographs) You want us to head back into the shadows and face something we don’t understand. It’s asking a lot.  85.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I know, but I’m not the one asking. (Turns to face everyone) I didn’t ask for any of this. Not for my wife to perish or my children to die. Not for sickness. Not for war. And certainly not for this girl... (Beat) But I can’t just sit back and let harm come to her. I’m surprised anyone here can...considering everything we’ve been through. (Beat) Don’t you understand? If we turn away from this now...we’ll never survive it. Frank stares at a sea of blank faces...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Isn’t there someone here who wants to stand up and say no more? When did we become the sort of people who peer out of windows and hide behind locked doors? That’s not us. That’s not who we are. (Beat) Who will stand up with me? Frank glances around the room...and starts to call names-

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bob?...Thomas?...Ralph?...Earl? Each man reluctantly shakes his head...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Charlie?...Ben? Both men shake their heads. Frank turns to his father-in-

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Eli? Eli Peterson stares at Frank with blank eyes...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're family.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: We were. Frank takes a deep breath, turning to one last person--  86.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Tom? Tom glances at his wife and son, then looks down...ashame

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What if it was your daughter? Tom slowly shakes his head with tears in his eyes--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It’s not. Edward stares at his father. Rosaleigh trembles in her se

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with you? All of you?! This is basic right and wrong... Rosaleigh can’t take it anymore. She suddenly erupts--

dialogues.speaker: ROSALEIGH
dialogues.text: Damnit, Frank, it’s easy for you to say...we have something to live for. You don’t! The room plunges to silence. It’s an awful thing say...bu Rosaleigh can’t take it back--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Is that what you think? (Then, to everyone) Is that what all of you think? Nobody responds or even looks Frank in the eye. They just stare at their hands...as if idly passing the time. Frank slowly puts on his hat...and walks out of the churc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank comes outside and stares at the empty street; imagi what will be like to face gunmen all by himself... A cold wind suddenly blows, dark and ominous; rattling th window panes like a harbinger of doom. Frank walks towards Sue’s clinic... INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE -- MAIN FLOOR -- MOMENTS LATER Frank comes inside and heads for the stairs. He sees Nath TIN STAR on the counter...and reluctantly picks it up. BE  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue and Leonard move quietly through the dark room, picki up the pieces after George’s terrible rampage... The door softly opens and Frank Sullivan comes inside. SHATTERED GLASS crunches beneath his feet... Frank turns on the light-- The room is torn asunder; books and equipment scattered o the floor, two wounded people standing in the shadows... Frank crosses the room and grabs Sue gently by the arm. S resists for a moment, then finally turns around-- Her face is bruised and bloody. Swollen eyes, split lip. Frank has to bite his hand just to keep from screaming--

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Frank, please...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It doesn’t matter. It’s over, he’s gone... Frank glances at the girl, expecting the worst-- SUE (CONT’D) She's fine. He didn’t hurt her. Frank, please...don't. Sue collapses into his arms and starts to cry. Frank hesitates, then gently strokes her hair--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Alright...alright. Leonard turns and quietly leaves the room. Frank waits fo the door to shut, then guides Sue over to the couch...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here, sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOWNSPEOPLE sit in stunned silence, glancing at each othe the weight of what happened starts to take hold-- A few people begin to stand up...and head for the door.  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank soaks a COTTON SWAB with ALCOHOL and begins to clea Sue’s wounds. She winces in pain--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Just stings a little. Frank slowly nods...and continues with care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOWNSPEOPLE come outside into the cold, grim night. Some linger for a moment, others start to head home...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know about everyone else, but I could sure use a drink... A few TOWNSPEOPLE follow Charlie towards the saloon... Tom, Rosaleigh, and Edward stand nearby. Edward watches t departing citizens, torn by everything he’s just seen...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: We should probably stay in the office tonight... (Off their looks) The walls are reinforced by steel. Rosaleigh stares at her husband, then nods...terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender turns on the lights and discovers George Fo sitting at the counter, nervously rubbing his hands... The bartender hesitates, then sets down a bottle of WHISK George pulls the cork and pours himself a drink...

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: George? Your hands are bleeding... George looks up as the door opens behind him. Charlie Fos and some other TOWNSPEOPLE begin to trickle inside... George grabs the bottle and flees into the back room... INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE -- SAME TIME Sue stares at Frank as he quietly treats her wounds...  89.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: He wasn’t always like this. Incase you were wondering...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Wondering what?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: (a moment, then) Why I married him. A TRAIN WHISTLE suddenly shrieks far in the distance; so faint that Frank and Sue barely seem to notice... SUE (CONT’D) You and Emily ever fight?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: On occasion.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Did it ever get...bad? Frank looks at her...and suddenly grasps her meaning--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No. Never. (Beat) It was always over little things. Should we get indoor plumbing? Buy a car? Was Kathryn old enough to date? We argued about the future... (Then, softly) Guess it was pretty silly, considering we didn’t have one. Frank tapes a BANDAGE to Sue’s cheek. They stare at each other for a moment, their faces just inches apart...

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Why did you leave me? Frank's eyes flicker, wounded and filled with regret--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don’t know how to answer that, Sue. I really don’t. Sue takes out the Rough Rider photograph, which she’s kep all this time. She slowly hands it to Frank--

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Was it everything they said it was going to be? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Roosevelt and his legendary Rough Riders...the adventure of a lifetime? Frank stares at the photograph, ashamed. SUE (CONT’D) I read stories about massacres... one newspaper called it genocide.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That’s one way of putting it... Frank stares at his past self, thinking of his son--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All men fight in wars for the same reason, Sue. It’s a matter of luck whether you get to be on the right side of history or not. Sue points to the young man in the photograph--

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: You know...every now and then, I think about the boy who left all those years ago...and what life would’ve been like had he stayed. (Beat) I imagine he would’ve been kind. The train whistle suddenly shrieks again; close enough no that Frank and Sue can hear its engine chugging forward.. SUE (CONT’D) Is there going to be more bloodshed? Frank's dark eyes give her the answer-- SUE (CONT’D) You’re certain?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: As much as I am that the earth turns.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Is Tom going to help you? Frank hesitates, then slowly shakes his head... SUE (CONT’D) What about the others?  gl. Frank holds up the TIN STAR Nathan abandoned--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m all alone on this. Frank sets the badge down and stares at it for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I never wondered why you married him. I always knew. The only thing I never understood was...why you didn't wait.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Frank, when you left...I was angry. I'm sorry... Frank reaches out and touches her bruised face. Sue leans into his hand as tears trickle down her cheek... Then, in the depths of silence, Frank hears something--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Listen...

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: What? There’s nothing.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Dramatic Beat) I know...the train stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOWNSPEOPLE stare at the distant station, where thick tuf of smoke float into the dark evening sky--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONG TRAIN sits on the tracks, lurking ominously in the night like a dark trojan horse. Then, suddenly-- A CAR DOOR bursts open... A MAN (40) steps onto the platform. All alone. Dressed in beautiful suit, wearing confidence like a bullet proof ve He looks around the empty station, smiling at the shadows Then he slowly turns...and walks straight into town--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man strolls down the street, whistling a familiar tun ("Do Not Forsake Me, Oh My Darling")  92. The melody floats through the air; cheerful and creepy. TOWNSPEOPLE flee into buildings as the stranger approache

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATRONS take cover...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay ducks out of view...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli Peterson sits at his desk, quietly listening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, Rosaleigh, and Edward exchange nervous glances...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farley watches a DARK FIGURE float past his window... INT. LEONARD DUSCHENE’S ROOM -- THAT MOMENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard slowly turns and opens his bedroom closet. He sta at his WWI UNIFORM...and then pulls out his RIFLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young girl squirms in fear as the whistling comes clo Sue checks her pulse. Frank goes to the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stranger looks up at the WWI BANNER and suddenly stop whistling. Then he smiles...and enters the saloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank steps away from the window and heads for the door. watches him leave, then glances back at the young girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stranger smiles as PATRONS stand up from behind their tables...and reluctantly sit back down--

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: You folks expecting a tornado or something? Charlie glances at Ben from the corner of his eye. Everyo else looks away, too frightened to answer...  93.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: What’1ll it be, Mister?

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Shot of rye, if ya got it. The bartender nods and starts to pour. The stranger glanc over his shoulder, drawing strength from everyone’s fear- STRANGER (CONT’D) Nice town ya got here.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Passing through?

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Something like that. The stranger picks up his drink and gulps it down--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Sullivan steps out into the empty street, making hi way towards the saloon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom stares quietly out the window, watching his friend ch through the night towards the unknown...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You going to go over there? Tom glances at his son, unsure. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stranger sets down his empty glass...

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Another? The stranger nods, why not? The bartender pours...

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Got a doctor around these parts? PATRONS glance nervously at each other... STRANGER (CONT’D) Say you get shot, for example... where would you go?  94.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: I really don’t know. I’m the not the person to talk to about that sort of thing. The stranger stares at the bartender and smiles--

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: What do I owe for the rye?

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Thirty cents...

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Tell you what... The stranger throws a wad of MONEY on the counter-- STRANGER (CONT’D) I’ll make it a hundred dollars...if you tell me who is the person to talk to about that sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: I don’t understand...

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Oh, I think you do. The bartender shakes his head as the stranger leans forwa focused, unrelenting...refusing to take no for an answer. And then, suddenly, they hear a door open-- Frank Sullivan comes into the bar. He stares at the stran for a moment, then sits down at a nearby table. The stranger glances at the bartender, “Him?” The bartender nods...and pockets the hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Frank listens to the stranger's approaching footsteps and then looks up as a dark shadow falls across his face-- STRANGER (CONT’D) I’m wondering if you could help me?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You don’t look like the sort of man who needs much help. The stranger smiles and sits down--  95.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: We all need a little help, especially in a strange town... (Beat) I’m looking for a girl. Medium build. Five and a half feet tall. Fair complexion. Very beautiful. (Beat) Sound like anybody you know? Frank shakes his head as the door opens again. Tom Donova quietly enters, followed by Reverend Farley... STRANGER (CONT’D) I work for some people who are very concerned about her. We have reason to believe she was in the area. Sent a couple men out looking for her, but...they seem to have disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Maybe they ran off together. Maybe they don’t want to be found...

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Well, if that’s the case, it’s even more important that we find them. The girl, at least.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Confused) What about the men?

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: As long as we find the girl, we'd be willing to forget about them. Call it an even exchange. (Dramatic Beat) Our men...for your deputy. The stranger sets a BLOOD-STAINED BADGE down on the table STRANGER (CONT’D) You'll be happy to know he was very brave. Didn’t even scream. Said to tell his kids he loved ‘em. Frank glances at Tom, frozen across the room. STRANGER (CONT’D) Is it a matter of money? If not, then what is it? I saw that cemetery when I came in. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRANGER (CONT’D) Pretty crowded. How many able- bodied men could this town possibly have left? Frank slowly looks up, calm and defiant-- STRANGER (CONT’D) Do you have any idea who you’re dealing with? Look what we did ina few short hours. You wired for the feds. Our men showed up, instead. Your telegraph is cut. Your train station is off the map. Don’t you realize how alone you are? Frank stares at the stranger...but doesn’t respond. BEAT. STRANGER (CONT’D) You know...I remember when the flu spread last year, the government sent a dispatch to towns like this. You probably got it... (Quoting) ...”Round up your woodworkers and set them to making coffins. Then round up your street laborers...and set them to digging graves." (Beat) That was all the help you got then. And it’s all you’re getting now. The stranger suddenly reaches into his coat. Everyone ten fearing he’s about to draw a gun... ..-but the stranger takes out a collection of PAPERS, instead. He looks up at Frank, smiling like the devil... STRANGER (CONT’D) Do you know how easy it is to intercept a telegraph? A few snips and a little cut...and the signal gets re-routed. (Holds up first page) From the town of Sparks... Everyone leans forward as the stranger reads--— STRANGER (CONT’D) ...Dear Sheriff, stop. We regret we have no men to send at this time, stop. Very sorry, stop. (Turns the page) From Dawson...Sheriff Donovan, stop. Unable to provide help, stop. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRANGER (CONT’D) Please keep us abreast as the situation unfolds, stop. (Turns the page) From Ridgeview... TOWNSPEOPLE start to look away, sensing the pattern... STRANGER (CONT’D) Have neither resources nor men to Spare, stop. Deeply regret, stop. (Looks up at Frank) «Good luck, stop. The stranger throws the papers down on the table-- STRANGER (CONT’D) You can read the rest for yourself. They all say the same thing. Nobody's coming. Why would they? Frank shuffles through the messages one at a time. The stranger watches, genuinely puzzled-- STRANGER (CONT’D) Why are you doing this? What’s in it for you? Do you even know who you're risking your life for? Frank's eyes flicker faintly with doubt-- STRANGER (CONT’D) You think she’s worth saving? A damsel in distress in need of a white knight? You think by defending her, you'll redeem this town? Maybe even yourself? That you've finally got a cause worth fighting for? Boy...have I got a few surprises for you. (Raising his voice) She's a hooker. Sorry to disappoint you, but...that’s what she is. A two-bit whore. Pay her enough, she'll do anything you want. Fucked the wrong guy, heard the wrong things. And now she’s a nothing witness in a nothing case... (Beat) You're telling me you’re gonna risk your life and lives of all these people to save someone like her? Have you thought this through? Trains and telegraphs are the least we can do. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRANGER (CONT’D) We'll wipe this town off the face of the earth. You’ll see. We're just getting warmed up. The stranger looks around the room as his words take hold STRANGER (CONT’D) Now why don’t you do the sensible thing and mind your own business? This girl has no friends. No family. When she’s gone, there will be no newspaper headlines mourning her death. She won’t have a funeral or even an obituary. Because no one will remember her long enough to forget her. It’ll be as though she never existed. All you have to do is order another drink and try not to worry about things that are beyond your control. Alright? Frank hesitates -- deep in thought. And then-- George Fowler comes out of the back room and takes a seat the bar, totally oblivious to what’s going on...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Excuse me... Frank stands up and charges across the room. The stranger watches, confused by his sudden departure...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE COUNTER
dialogues.text: Frank grabs Charlie’s empty BEER GLASS and hurls it right into George’s face. He looks up, stunned-- Frank knocks two of his teeth out with the first blow. Th second bruises a kidney and the third cracks a rib... TOWNSPEOPLE flee from the eye of the storm..

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: The stranger watches the attack with a faint smile; as if suddenly recognizing a worthy opponent...

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Tom steps forward, trying to restore order--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Frank! Frank! That’s enough! You’re killing him!  99. Frank slams George's face into the counter, shards of gla splinter his skin. George drops to the ground-- Frank bends over, about to lift him to his feet... ..+.-when he suddenly hears the click of a gun--

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, Frank, I said enough! Frank looks up and sees Tom pointing a SHOTGUN at him fro across the room. His eyes fill with betrayal...and rage.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Back away. Now. Frank slowly approaches his friend--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You’re gonna shoot me, Tom? Or just arrest me? Tom peers over the shotgun as Frank takes a step closer; barrels now just inches from his chest. And then-- Frank snatches the gun out of Tom’s hands. Everyone gasps he opens the boxlock, letting the shells fall to the floo

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're not doing either today... (Quoting Tom from earlier) Now, why don’t you do what you’re good at, Sheriff...and stand aside. Frank throws the gun down and charges back across the roo

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sam, whiskey. The bartender sets a BOTTLE down. Frank picks it up...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE END OF THE BAR
dialogues.text: George pulls himself to his feet. Blood pours down his fa blinding his vision. He slowly turns around... ...Frank smashes his face with the whiskey bottle! Glass shatters, the alcohol stinging like acid. George screams...and goes down for the count. But Frank is on top of him, punching and wailing, kicking stomping, beating this man within an inch of his life.  100.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: The stranger glances around the saloon, assessing differe people's reactions. Some seem horrified. Others, inspired

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: Finally, Frank stops. Just short of murder. He grabs Geor by the collar and gets right in his face...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at me...this is what happens when you hurt women. Frank throws George back to the ground, then slowly turns around to face the lingering stranger--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were saying? The stranger smiles. And picks up right where he left off

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: There’s no need for you to go and get the good people of this town hurt. All we want is the girl. Frank wipes the blood off his face, then--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You can’t have her. The stranger stares at Frank with a faint smile. There it The dye is cast. Frank Sullivan has crossed the Rubicon. The stranger glances at George writhing on the ground, th walks across the room...and disappears out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stranger looks up once more at the WWI banner. Then h turns and walks down the street...whistling the entire wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stares at at Frank Sullivan-- He doesn’t ask for any help or offer any explanations. He just puts one foot in front of the other... .--and charges right out the front door. BEAT. Tom watches the door shut, then walks across the room and picks up his deputy’s TIN STAR. He wipes it with his thum  101. .-.the blood smears across the metal, leaving Tom Donovan stare at his own reflection in the brass-colored tin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue looks up as Frank comes into the room. She sees the b on his shirt. Her eyes suddenly go wide--

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You have to leave now...

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Why? Are they coming?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No...they’re already here. Frank grabs Sue by the arm and pulls her to the door...

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Frank, wait a minute. Frank... (Then, screaming) ...take your hands off me! Frank suddenly lets go. Sue looks at him, softly--

dialogues.speaker: SUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. Frank nods quietly, then glances at the girl; still aslee completely unaware of what this man is about to do for he SUE (CONT’D) Are you sure about this? Frank hesitates, then slowly shakes his head-- SUE (CONT’D) Then don’t. Please, just...don’t.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It’s too late. I’m sorry... Frank turns and heads for the door. Sue follows him, realizing she may never see him again--

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: I don’t understand...why is this your responsibility? Frank, stop! She grabs his arm, desperate to make him stay--  102. SUE (CONT’D) Tell me why! Why do you have to go out there and face this alone? Frank suddenly erupts, frustrated and out of time--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, because I don’t have a choice. Because there’s a chance I might be able to help someone tonight. And I have to go. Do you understand? I have to go. Sue slowly lets go of his arm. Frank stares at her for a moment, then nods at the young girl--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Push her away from the window before the fighting starts... And then he turns and walks down the hall...

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Frank? (He stops, turns around) When it’s all over, I'll be here... (Softly) .--waiting. Frank slowly nods, then disappears down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank comes outside into the cold night air, crunching gr beneath his boots as he walks down the empty street... He takes position behind a building and waits; his rifle trembling in his hands; his breathing deep and heavy... Frank Sullivan is afraid -- we can see it in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue pushes the girl’s bed away from the window, then clos the shutters and leans against the wall. Her eyes close with dread. She slides down to the floor..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Farley kneels in the third row of his empty chur hands clasped together tightly in prayer...  103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom comes inside, shaken and undone. He stares at his wif for a moment, then hears a soft clicking sound... Edward is standing across the room, loading a RIFLE--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Were you and Mom going to ask about the limp in my step?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (Hesitates) I hadn’t noticed...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Sure you did. You both did. You just pretended not to. Tom steps forward, scared to know the answer--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Edward, I asked you a question... why are you loading that rifle? Edward slides a final round into the chamber and slams it home. He turns to face his father--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It was just outside Neuve Chapelle. I took a bullet in the thigh...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You never mentioned it in your letters.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: There were a lot of things I didn’t mention in my letters... (Beat) There was a french family who gave me shelter. If the Germans had found me, that family would’ve been executed. I was a stranger to them just like this girl is a stranger to you ...and yet they risked their lives in order to save mine. Edward turns to leave, having made his point...  104.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: To do what I can... Tom pulls Edward back from the door--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No, damnit, you’re staying here! Your mother and I didn’t wait through that blasted war just to lose you in some street brawl!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Let go of me, I’m not a child--!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You're my child! Edward looks at his father, suddenly calm--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I know you’re afraid... (Beat) But I’m only alive because of people like Frank Sullivan. Tom's grip weakens and Edward pulls way. He glances at hi mother one last time, then opens the door...and leaves. Rosaleigh turns to Tom, frantic and undone--

dialogues.speaker: ROSALEIGH
dialogues.text: Tom? Do something! Tom goes to the window and watches his son walk away. The takes out his deputy’s tin star...and stares at it once m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie Foster and Ben Sanderford hover around George Fow crunching glass beneath their cautious footsteps...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. That was the finest beating I ever saw.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Frank went too far. George didn’t deserve that... Eli Peterson suddenly steps forward--  105.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: No, he deserved worse. And sooner. Any man lays a hand on his wife has it comin’. Call me old fashioned. TOWNSPEOPLE glance at each other quietly as Eli stares at blood-soaked man squirming on the floor--

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My son-in-law is about to die alone in the street... (Then, softly) What have we become?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stranger’s footsteps echo as he walks quietly along t train. He stops at the engine and slowly turns around... Then, suddenly-- The stranger stops whistling. On that signal, every single car door suddenly opens... FIFTY GANGSTERS step out into the night, dressed in BLACK COATS, dangling TOMMY GUNS like samurai swords...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank grips his gun tightly as he waits in the darkness. hears a faint rustling...and glances across the street-- Leonard Duschene is crouched in an alley, holding his rif Frank nods quietly. Leonard nods back. And then-- Movement from above suddenly catches Frank's eye... TOWNSPEOPLE are taking position to help in the fight-- ..-Charlie Foster throws a rifle up to Ben Sanderson, the climbs a fire escape to the top of the saloon... ..+.-BAR PATRONS take cover in the alleys... ..-Eli Peterson and the Civil War vets crouch along the rooftops, drawing their service revolvers one at a time.. ...-Tom and Edward Donovan stand side by side, each point rifle towards the darkness up ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town sits quietly beneath a brilliant FULL MOON, enjo its last few moments of peace and tranquility... Suddenly, the barrel of a TOMMY GUN dips into FRAME, foll by BLACK BOOTS and an army of dark TRENCH COATS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Sullivan sees the approaching shadows. He glances a the other TOWNSPEOPLE. They all take cover... The gangsters pass beneath the WWI BANNER, glancing up at quiet rooftops as they make their way into town... TOWNSPEOPLE grip their weapons, waiting for Frank’s move. Frank takes a deep breath as the shadows pass by. Finally steps into full view, takes aim...and pulls the trigger. A GANGSTER'S head explodes in a bright puff of red...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue looks up at the crack of Frank’s rifle. Outside, GUNF erupts. The terrifying rapid fire of TOMMY GUNS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WWI BANNER falls to the ground as MACHINE GUNS explod Frank and the TOWNSPEOPLE dive for cover as bullets slam buildings, splintering wood and shattering windows... The guns expel thousands of rounds, each with the power t cut a man’s body apart. But then the magazines empty... And the townspeople seize their moment-- They step out of hiding as the gangsters reload. Frank fi again, followed by Leonard, Tom, Eli, Charlie, and Ben-- Five gangsters fall as the rest dive for cover. They relo their TOMMY GUNS...and the bombardment continues--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: QUICK INTERIOR SHOTS -- Sue, Rosaleigh, and Kay all dive cover as BULLETS hit their buildings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER WIDE SHOT -- PEOPLE who fled the town earlier stand in the distance, watching GUNFIRE light up their homes...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: An aging CIVIL WAR VET is the first townsperson to die. H takes three shots in the torso and slumps over the roof..

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A BAR PATRON takes a shot in the head...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Charlie and Ben stand up to shoot...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Tom and Edward takes turns covering and firing...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Leonard Duschene kills two gangsters from the alley, then gets driven back by a barrage of gunfire...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Frank dives behind a Model-T. Gunshots shatter the window Frank leans forward and fires beneath the engine. A GANGSTER’S shin explodes and he falls to the ground. Frank finishes him off with a shot to the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue crawls along the floor and peers out the window. Outs bodies fill the street as TOWNSPEOPLE take cover... Sue glances at the young girl, clearly conflicted. Outsid another TOWNSPERSON falls, wounded... Sue fills a BLACK MEDICAL BAG...and dashes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stranger blasts away with his tommy gun as he walks d the street. Calm. Unafraid. Shielded by shadows. He shoots a CIVIL WAR VET. Then a BAR PATRON. Then a RANC on a ROOF. The stranger watches his body slump forward, falling four stories to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue comes outside and races down the alley. She kneels be the rancher as gunfire ricochets around them...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: GANGSTERS step out into the street, clearly gaining groun TOWNSPEOPLE fall back, retreating for cover...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Sue dodges bullets as she darts between patients; doing whatever she can as the madness rages around her...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The stranger empties his gun and then signals for a cease fire. An eerie silence falls on the town... .-.except for faint cries of men in their death throes--

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: (Shouting) You hear that?! Nobody wants this! Just give us the girl!! There’s a thousand dollars for any man who tells us where she is! BAM! A GANGSTER takes a bullet in the head and falls to t ground. The stranger ducks as his men resume firing--

dialogues.speaker: TOWNSPERSON
dialogues.text: (Shouting) Keep your money! The stranger’s face hardens. He shouts to someone nearby-

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Who’s got the grenades? QUICK SHOT -- Edward Donovan’s eyes go wide...

dialogues.speaker: GANGSTER
dialogues.text: I do!

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Use ‘em! GANGSTER #1 pulls the pin on a GRENADE and tosses it onto roof where Charlie and Ben are positioned! QUICK SHOT -- Edward screams, too late--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Get out of there!  109. BOOM!!! A giant EXPLOSION sends the two regulars to their maker. TOWNSPEOPLE lurch back, horrified--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The stranger smiles, then nods for his men to continue. T fire into buildings, shattering windows... Then they toss in grenades-- BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! The explosions rock the town; one of the buildings collap in flames. The TOMMY GUNS resume firing...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Tom screams to Edward as everyone dives for cover--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: ‘The hell are those things?!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Shoot ‘em as they throw!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Cover me! Edward stands to fire. Tom lays down some cover...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Gangster #1 pulls the pin of a GRENADE...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
